intro: Leptodermis hirsutiflora var. hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered leptodermis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
